sessions.title: PTSD Therapy Session 1
sessions.description: Practice mindfulness and Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) techniques to manage PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 10-15 minutes.
sessions.script:
`Welcome to your PTSD therapy session. In this session, we'll be practicing mindfulness and Cognitive Behavioral Therapy techniques to help you manage mild PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 5-10 minutes. Find a quiet place where you can relax.
Start by sitting comfortably. Take a deep breath in, hold for a few seconds, and then slowly exhale. Let’s repeat this a few times, focusing on the sensation of your breath entering and leaving your body. Feel your chest and belly rise and fall with each breath.
Now, let's focus on the present moment. Look around the room and name 5 things you can see. Notice the colors and shapes. Next, name 4 things you can touch. Feel their texture. This exercise helps you feel grounded in the here and now.
Think of a recent situation where you felt anxious or overwhelmed. Notice what thoughts come to mind. Are these thoughts based on facts or assumptions? Gently challenge them. Replace negative thoughts with a more balanced perspective. For example, instead of 'I can’t handle this,' try 'I have faced challenges before, and I can get through this too.'
Now, let’s repeat a positive affirmation: 'I am capable, and I have the strength to overcome challenges.' Say it out loud or in your mind. Let these words sink in as you take another deep breath.
Thank you for completing this session. Remember, practicing mindfulness and challenging negative thoughts regularly can help manage mild PTSD symptoms. Take your time as you transition back to your day.

sessions.title: PTSD Therapy Session 2
sessions.description: Relaxation techniques and self-care strategies for mild PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 5 minutes.
sessions.script:
Welcome to your PTSD therapy session. In this session, we will focus on relaxation techniques and self-care strategies to help you manage mild PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 5 minutes. Make sure you're in a comfortable and quiet space.
Start by focusing on your breath. Inhale slowly through your nose, hold for a few seconds, and exhale gently through your mouth. Let your breath relax your body with each cycle.
Next, we will practice progressive muscle relaxation. Start by tightening the muscles in your toes and feet for a few seconds, then slowly release. Move up your body, tightening and releasing each muscle group: your legs, stomach, hands, arms, shoulders, and face.
Now, take a moment to reflect on something positive from your day, no matter how small. It could be a moment of calm, something you’re grateful for, or a personal achievement. Allow that positive feeling to fill your mind.
To conclude, take a few deep breaths again. As you exhale, imagine releasing any remaining tension. When you’re ready, slowly bring your awareness back to the present.

sessions.title: PTSD Therapy Session 1
sessions.description: Focus on Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (TF-CBT) and Exposure Therapy to help manage PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 5-10 minutes.
sessions.script:
Welcome to your PTSD therapy session. In this session, we'll focus on Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and Exposure Therapy to help you manage moderate PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 5-10 minutes. Make sure you're in a comfortable, quiet space.
Let’s begin with a few deep breaths. Inhale deeply through your nose, hold for a moment, and then slowly exhale through your mouth. With each breath, feel your body becoming more relaxed. Take your time with this.
Think of a situation where you felt afraid or anxious. What thoughts crossed your mind at that moment? Now, let’s challenge those thoughts. Ask yourself: 'Are these thoughts based on facts?' 'Is there another way to look at this situation?' Replace any negative or irrational thoughts with more balanced and positive ones.
Next, we’ll take small steps towards confronting a memory that triggers your PTSD. Imagine the memory, but from a distance, like you're watching it on a screen. As you do, notice your feelings. It’s okay if you feel discomfort—just acknowledge it. Repeat this exercise until the intensity of your feelings lessens. You are safe now, and you’re in control of this process.
Take a moment to visualize a peaceful place where you feel safe and calm. It could be a real place or one you’ve created in your mind. Picture yourself there now, surrounded by peaceful sights and sounds. Focus on how relaxed you feel in this place.
Great job completing this session. Remember, gradual exposure to memories and challenging negative thoughts can reduce their power over time. Practice this technique as needed, and always reach out to a professional if you need support.

sessions.title: PTSD Therapy Session 2
sessions.description: Integration of coping strategies and relaxation techniques to manage PTSD. This session will take about 5 minutes.
sessions.script:
Welcome to your PTSD therapy session. In this session, we'll integrate various coping strategies and relaxation techniques to help you manage your PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 5 minutes. Find a calm space and get comfortable.
Start by practicing deep breathing for 5 minutes. Inhale slowly, hold, and exhale. Feel each breath bringing relaxation to your body.
Next, we will practice grounding. Touch something nearby and focus on its texture and temperature. Remind yourself of the present moment. You are here, and you are safe.
To end, visualize a safe and peaceful place. Imagine the sights, sounds, and smells. Spend a few moments immersing yourself in that peaceful feeling, then slowly bring your attention back to the present.

sessions.title: PTSD Therapy Session 3
sessions.description: Mindfulness and grounding exercises for moderate PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 5 minutes.
sessions.script:
Welcome to your PTSD therapy session. In this session, we will focus on mindfulness and grounding exercises to help manage moderate PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 20 minutes. Find a comfortable place to sit.
Let's begin by grounding yourself in the present moment. Look around and name 5 things you can see. Notice their colors and textures. Now, name 4 things you can feel, 3 things you can hear, 2 things you can smell, and 1 thing you can taste. This will bring your focus to the here and now.
As you complete this, take a few deep breaths. Inhale through your nose, hold, and exhale through your mouth. With each exhale, feel your body relax.

sessions.title: PTSD Therapy Session 4
sessions.description: Cognitive restructuring to help challenge and reframe negative thoughts related to trauma. This session will take about 5-10 minutes.
sessions.script:
Welcome to your PTSD therapy session. In this session, we'll focus on cognitive restructuring, which will help you challenge and reframe negative thoughts related to your trauma. This session will take about 5-10 minutes.
Start by recalling a recent negative thought you had related to your trauma. Write it down. Now, let's work on challenging that thought by asking if it's based on facts. Is it a belief that’s helping you, or is it holding you back?
Next, let’s reframe the thought. Think of a way you can view the situation more positively or neutrally. How can you change the thought to help you heal?
Take a moment to appreciate the strength it takes to work through these thoughts. You are making progress, even if it doesn’t always feel like it.

sessions.title: PTSD Therapy Session 1
sessions.description: Focus on Prolonged Exposure Therapy and Narrative Exposure Therapy to help manage  PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 5-10 minutes.
sessions.script:
Welcome to your PTSD therapy session. In this session, we'll be focusing on Prolonged Exposure Therapy and Narrative Exposure Therapy. This session will take about 5-10 minutes. Find a comfortable space where you can fully focus on yourself and this process.
Let’s begin with a deep breathing exercise. Breathe in slowly for 4 seconds, hold for 4, and exhale for 4. Continue this rhythm, allowing your body to relax with each breath. Feel your body becoming lighter as you release tension.
In this step, we will revisit a traumatic memory. Imagine yourself in the memory, but with the understanding that you are now safe. Start by describing the memory in detail—what happened, where you were, and how you felt. It’s important to remember that this is a controlled exercise, and you are safe now.
As you reflect on the memory, notice the emotions it triggers. Now, imagine you are telling your story from a place of strength. Focus on the ways you’ve survived and the lessons you’ve learned. You have the power to rewrite the narrative of this experience.
Take a moment to see the memory as part of your life story, not as something that defines you. You have faced challenges and continued to move forward. Remind yourself that you are resilient, and you are not defined by the trauma you’ve experienced.
Now, let’s end with a positive affirmation: 'I am strong. I am healing. I have the power to overcome this.' Repeat this affirmation as many times as needed, allowing it to reinforce your sense of strength.
Thank you for completing this session. Remember, healing from severe PTSD takes time, and every step you take is a victory. You are not alone in this journey, and with continued support, you can heal and thrive.

sessions.title: PTSD Therapy Session 2
sessions.description: Advanced exposure techniques and trauma processing exercises for severe PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 5-10 minutes.
sessions.script:
Welcome to your advanced PTSD therapy session. In this session, we'll be working on advanced exposure techniques and trauma processing exercises to help you manage severe PTSD symptoms. This session will take about 5-10 minutes. Please ensure you're in a quiet and comfortable environment.
Begin with a few minutes of deep breathing. Focus on your breath as it enters and leaves your body. Take your time to relax.
Now, recall a specific traumatic memory and allow yourself to feel it, but remember you're safe in this space. Focus on the details of the memory, and then gradually distance yourself from it as you focus on your breathing.
It’s okay if the memory feels overwhelming. If it becomes too intense, take a break, breathe deeply, and refocus on the present moment. Your mind and body are strong, and you are in control of this process.

sessions.title: PTSD Therapy Session 3
sessions.description: Complete narrative exposure therapy for those working through severe trauma. This session will take about 5 minutes.
sessions.script:
Welcome to your PTSD therapy session. In this session, we'll conduct narrative exposure therapy, where you'll work through the traumatic experience in a safe and controlled manner. This session will take about 5 minutes.
Start by recalling your trauma in as much detail as possible. Describe what happened, where it took place, and how you felt. Remember, you are in a safe space, and this is part of the healing process.
As you recall the events, allow yourself to express the emotions that arise, but remain grounded. You can pause at any time if the feelings become overwhelming. When you feel ready, continue reflecting on the experience, but start focusing on what has helped you heal and grow since then.
To conclude, take a deep breath in, hold for a few seconds, and exhale slowly. Allow yourself to feel the release of any tension and acknowledge the strength you've shown today.
